en: Despite the many challenges they face, some, like Lazarious Ramolotja have beaten the odds and succeeded to establish their own companies.
tsn: Le fa ba lebagane le dikgwetlho di le dintsi, ba bangwe, jaaka Lazarious Ramolotja ba fentse  mathata mme ba atlegile mo go simololeng ditlamo tsa bona.

en: Ramolotja is one of over more than two million deaf people in the country.
tsn: Ramolotja ke mongwe wa ba ba fetang dimilione di le pedi tsa bosusu mo nageng ya rona.

en: He says deaf people struggle daily to meaningfully participate in the economy.
tsn: A re bosusu ba kgaratlha letsatsi le letsatsi go tsaya karolo mo ikonoming.

en: The 43-year-old father of three runs a welding business.
tsn: Rre wa dingwaga di le 43 o tsamaisa kgwebo ya go monaganya ditshipi.

en: He shares his story with us, with the help of a professional interpreter, Sebone Kgethe.
tsn: O abelana kgang ga gagwe le rona ka thuso ya motoloki wa seporofešenale, Sebone Kgethe.

en: My name is Lazarious Ramolotja.
tsn: Leina la me ke Lazarious Ramolotja.

en: I stay in a village called Seweding in Mahikeng.
tsn: Ke nna mo Motseng o o bidiwang Seweding mo go Mahikeng .

en: I am a father of three.
tsn: Ke rre wa bana ba le bararo.

en: I started welding many years ago.
tsn: Ke simolotse go momaganya ditshipi dingwaga di le dintsi tse di fetileng.

en: I now have my own company.
tsn: Ga jaana, ke na le setlamo sa me.

en: With his skills clearly outweighing his disability, Ramolotja has found a way to communicate with his clients.
tsn: Ka bokgoni jwa gagwe jo bo fetang bogole jwa gagwe, Ramolotja o bone tsela ya go buisana le badirisi ba gagwe.

en: He says there’s no communication barrier.
tsn: A re ga go na dikgoreletsi dipe tsa tlhaeletsano.

en: Deaf people around here don’t have businesses.
tsn: Bosusu ba ba nnang fa ga ba na dikgwebo.

en: So, I thought to myself that I should have my own business.
tsn: Ka jalo ke ne ka akanya gore ke tshwanetse go nna le kgwebo ya me.

en: It does not matter.
tsn: Seo ga se re sepe.

en: If there is a communication barrier, there is a pen and paper.
tsn: Fa go na le dikgoreletsi tsa tlhaeletsano, go na le pene le pampiri.

en: It doesn’t mean I need an interpreter all the time.
tsn: Ga go reye gore ke tlhoka moranodi ka dinako tsotlhe.

en: People know that I am deaf and can see that I am deaf, and they can also see that I am a skilled person.
tsn: Batho ba a itse go ke susu. Le nna ke a ipona gore ke susu, mme ba kgona go lemoga gore ke motho yo o nang le bokgoni.

en: I want to see deaf people having their own businesses, he says.
tsn: Ke batla go bona bosusu ba bangwe ba na le dikgwebo tsa bone, a rialo.

en: According to the World Health Organisation, over 5% of the world’s population has disabling hearing loss.
tsn: Go ya ka World Health Organisation, palo e e fetang diperesente di le 5 ya baagi mo lefatsheng ba latlhegetswe ke kutlo .

en: Access to education and job opportunities remain key challenges for the deaf community.
tsn: Phitlhelelo ya thuto le ditšhono tsa ditiro di tswelela go nna kgwetlho e kgolo ya baagi ba bosusu.

en: COVID-19 has also proven a big barrier for the deaf community.
tsn: COVID-19 le yona e e tshupile fa e le sekgoreletsi se segolo mo baaging ba bosusu.

en: Interpreting coronavirus messaging has become an uphill battle.
tsn: Go toloka melaetsa ya coronavirus ke ntwa e e ntseng e ya magoletsa.

en: Ramolotja says he still doesn’t understand much about the virus.
tsn: Ramolotja a re o santse a sa tlhaloganye go le gontsi ka ga mogare.

en: COVID-19, I felt the pinch of it. I suffered a lot
tsn: COVID-19, ke e ikutlwetse sentle. Ke sotlegile thata.

en: As a deaf person, I do not know much about this coronavirus.
tsn: Jaaka susu, ga ke itse go le gontsi ka ga coronavirus.

en: The hearing people can hear for themselves but for deaf people, it is a challenge.
tsn: Batho ba ba kgonang go utlwa ba kgona go ikutlwela ka bobona mme go disusu, ke kgwetlho.

en: We suffer, he says.
tsn: Re itemogela tshotlego, a bua jalo.

en: Sebone Kgethe parents are deaf.
tsn: Batsadi ba ga Sebone Kgethe ke disusu.

en: She is also a professional sign language interpreter.
tsn: Gape ke motoloki wa porofešenale wa puo ya diatla.

en: She agrees that deaf people face socioeconomic barriers daily.
tsn: O dumela gore bosusu ba lebagana le dikgoreletsi tsa loago letsatsi le letsatsi.

en: The deaf community is urging government to speed up the process of making sign language an official language.
tsn: Bosusu ba rotloetsa puso go itlhaganedisa tsamaiso ya dira gore puo ya diatla e nne puo ya semmuso.

en: Messages of congratulations continue to pour in for South African Netflix documentary, My Octopus Teacher, which has won the Oscar for Best Documentary Feature at the 93rd Academy Awards Ceremony in Los Angeles.
tsn: Melaetsa ya kakgolo e tswelela go thologela mo Aforikaborwa ka ntlha ya lenaneo la tshedimosetso la Netflix, “My Octopus Teacher” le le fentseng mokgele wa Oscar kwa moletlong wa diawate wa bo 93 kwa Los Angeles.

en: Industry professionals have lauded the team for winning the highest accolade in international film.
tsn: Baporofešenale ba intaseteri ba bakile setlhopha se ka go amogela kabelo e e kwa godimo mo filiming ya boditšhabatšhaba.

en: The film has bagged a host of other international film awards, and has won over hearts and minds worldwide.
tsn: Filimi e, e iponetse ditšhono tse dingwe tse dintsi tsa dikgele tsa filimi tsa boditšhabatšhaba, mme e fentse dipelo le dikgopolo tsa batho mo lefatsheng ka bophara.

en: Award-winning film producer, Anant Singh, explains why this award is great for the industry.
tsn: Montshakuno yo o dirang difilimi, Anant Singh, o tlhalosa gore ke goreng sekgele se, se le segolo mo intasetering.

en: It’s great for the industry because you’ve got a little film which is a documentary that competes in the best and the highest platform of world cinema and that wins in the best Oscar in the documentary category
tsn: Se segolo mo intasetering ka gonne o na le filimi e nnye ya tshedimosetso, e e tsenelang dikgaisano tsa maemo a a kwa godimo tsa dibaesekopo mo lefatsheng, mme e tswelele gonna mampodi ka mo setlhopheng sa Oscar ya tshedimosetso.

en: You know filmmakers are making documentaries from little films on their iphones and this gives them huge inspiration to continue and be passionate about story-telling.
tsn: O a itse gore badiri ba difilimi ba dira mananeo a tshedimosetso go tswa mo difiliming tse dinnye mo megaleng ya bona ya letheka (Iphones) mme se se ba neela thotloetso e kgolo go tswelela le nna le mantlhontlhotlho mo go tlotleleng batho dikgang.

en: Craig has been a passionate story-teller of documentaries and such a wonderful person who does great work and we are very fortunate to have worked with him 8 or 10 years ago.
tsn: Craig e ne e ntse e le motlotli wa dikgang tse di nang le tshedimosetso yo o mantlhontlhotlho, e le motho yo o siameng, yo o dirang tiro e ntle mme re ikutlwa re le lesego gore re be re dirile le ena mo dingwageng di le 10 tse di fetileng.

en: The documentary is a collaboration driven by the Sea Change Project, an NGO which raises awareness of the beauty and ecological importance of South Africa’s kelp forest.
tsn: Lenaneo la tshedimoseto ke tiro e e tshwaranetsweng e e  tsamaisiwang ke porojeke ya “The Sea Change”  e e leng NGO e e tsosang temogo ya bontle le botlhokwa jwa ekholoji jwa sekgwa sa mo Amorikaborwa sa Kelp.

en: The team is proud of the global recognition.
tsn: Setlhopha se motlotlo ka go bonwa ke lefatshe ka bophara.

en: It’s such a great platform for the work that were doing at the sea change project we’ve really focussed on the great African sea forest.
tsn: Ke tsela e ntle ya go bewa mo seraleng ka tiro e re e dirang kwa porojekeng ya “Sea Change”. Re tota re tsepamesitse megopolo mo sekgweng se segolo sa Aforika.

en: Our mission is to continue telling stories about this wonderful ecosystem so it can inspire and create awe in other people to want to protect nature, to want to relate to nature to want to immerse themselves in nature this is what we hope for people to remember that you are wild, that you are nature that this beautiful planet is your home that is really what we were trying to say in the film how wild places and wild animals are precious and that we all belong here, says Swati Thiyagarajan from the sea Change Project.
tsn: Maikaelelo a rona ke go tswelela go tlhaba ditlhamane ka ga tikologo e e monate gore e tle e kgone go rotloetsa le go gakgamatsa batho gore le bona ba batle go sireletsa tlhago, ba batle go amana le yona le go batla go nwelelela mo go yona. Se ke se re solofelang gore batho ba tlaa se gakologelwa. Ba gakologelwe gore ba tlhaga, gore o tlhago ka bowena, gore polanete e ntle e, ke legae la gago. Se ke sona tota se re neng re leka go se bua mo filiming, gore mafelo a a tlhaga le diphologolo tse di tlhaga di botlhokwa le gore rotlhe re bontlhabongwe jwa fano. Go bua Swati Thiyagarajan go tswa kwa porojekeng ya Sea Change.

en: In an earlier interview with SABC News, the star of the film Foster said the Octopus taught him that nature and human beings are woven from the same cloth and thread.
tsn: Mo dipolotsong le ba dikgang tsa SABC pejana fale, naledi ya filimi ya “Foster” o rile Octopus e mo rutile gore tlhago le batho di dirilwe go tswa mo leseleng le le lengwe fela.

en: And that each needs the other in order to survive on planet Earth.
tsn: Le gore e nngwe e tlhoka e nngwe gore e tle e kgone go tshela mo lefatsheng le.

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa says the film has opened a window into the natural beauty and diversity of South Africa’s oceans and marine ecosystems.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyri Ramaphosa A re filimi e, e butse letlhabaphefo la go ka bona bontle jwa tlhago le pharologano magareng ga mawatle a Aforikaborwa le tikologong ya lewatle.

en: Congratulations once again to the production team of MyOctopusTeacher for winning Best Documentary Feature at the Oscars.
tsn: Re boa gape re lebogisa setlhopha sa “My Octopus Teacher” ka go amogela sekgele sa lenaneo la tshedimosetso la maemo a a kwa godimo kwa di Oscars.

en: Western Cape Premier Alan Winde has also congratulated the team.
tsn: Tonakgolo ya kwa Kapa Bophirima, Alan Winde le ena o akgotse setlhopha.

en: South African film producer, Anant Singh, has hailed Oscar winning documentary, My Octopus Teacher, as a passionate ode to conservation by filmmaker, Craig Foster.
tsn: Montshakuno yo o dirang difilimi mo Aforikaborwa, Anant Singh, o pakile lenaneo la tshedimosetso le le gapileng sekgele sa Oscar “My Octopus Teacher”, jaaka mokgwa wa go bontsha lorato la tlhago go tswa go modiri wa difilimi, Craig Foster.

en: Foster’s film won Best Documentary at the 93rd Academy Awards ceremony in Los Angeles.
tsn: Filimi ya ga Foster e ikgapetse sekgele kwa moletlong wa diawate tsa akatemi wa bo 93 kwa Los Angeles.

en: The Netflix original documents his experiences with a young octopus that he keeps track of for a year.
tsn: Lenaneo la Netflix la mannete le tlhagisa maitemogelo a gagwe le okotopase e nnye e a dulang a e tlhokometse ngwaga otlhe.

en: The two eventually form a bond, allowing Foster to see the animal’s underwater world through her eyes.
tsn: Bobedi jo bo feleletsa bo  aga botsalano jo bo letlang Foster go bona botshelo jwa phologolo e jwa kwa tlase ga metsi ka matlho a gagwe.

en: Singh says Foster’s win has inspired a new generation of film makers.
tsn: Singh a re phenyo ya ga Foster e rotloeditse setlhopha se sešwa sa badiri ba difilimi.

en: Filmmakers are making documentaries from their iPhone’s and this gives them huge inspiration to continue and be passionate about storytelling.
tsn: Badiri ba difilimi ba di dira maneneo a tshedimosetso go tswa mo megaleng ya bona ya matheka (Iphone) mme se se ba neela thotloetso e e kgolo ya gore ba tswelele go tlotla dikgang ka manontlhotlho.

en: Craig has been a passionate storyteller of documentaries and such a wonderful person who does great work.
tsn: Craig e ne e ntse e le motho yo o nang le lerato la go dira mananeo a tshedimosetso. E le motho yo o siameng, yo o dirang tiro e ntle.

en: We were very fortunate to work with him on a film about 8 or 10 years ago, he adds.
tsn: Re nnile lesego thata go dira le ene mo filimimg mo dingwageng di le 8 kgotsa di le 10 tse di fetileng, a tlaleletsa.

en: Western Cape Premier, Alan Winde, has congratulated the winners of the South Africa Netflix documentary for bagging the award.
tsn: Tonakgolo ya Kapa Bophirima, Alan Winde, o akgotse bafenyi ba lenaneo la tshedimosetso la Netflix mo Aforikaborwa ka go bona sekgele.

en: Winde says the country is proud of the achievement.
tsn: Winde a re naga e ipela ka Katlego eo.

en: I would really like to say on behalf of our government in the Western Cape, to everyone involved in the making of the film, My Octopus Teacher, congratulations.
tsn: Ke rata go bua mo boemong jwa puso ya rona ya kwa Kapa Bophirima, go mongwe le mongwe yo o nang le seabe mo go dirweng ga filimi ya “My Octopus Teacher, re a lo akgola.

en: You make us so proud.
tsn: Lo re dira motlotlo thata.

en: It really was an amazing feat in winning that Oscar.
tsn: E ne e le phitlhelelo e e gakgamatsang ka go fenya Oscar.

en: Craig Foster says he is deeply honoured to receive this accolade.
tsn: Craig o re o ikutlwa a tlotlegile that go amogela kabelo e.

en: The 2020 Netflix original by Pippa Ehrlich and James Reed documents a year spent by filmmaker Craig Foster forging a relationship with a wild, common octopus in a South African kelp forest in False Bay near Cape Town.
tsn: Lenaneo la mannete la Netflix la 2020 la ga Pippa Ehrlich le James Reed le bontsha ngwaga o modiri wa difilimi Craig Foster a o feditseng a dira botsalano le dilo tse di tlhaga, le oketopase e e tlwaelegileng kwa sekgweng sa Aforikaborwa sa Kelp kwa False Bay gaufi le Cape Town.

en: Filmmakers James Reed and Pippa Ehrlich accepted the honour.
tsn: Badiri ba difilimi James Reed le Pippa Ehrlich ba amogetse tlotlo .

en: I know there are many South Africans who are awake in the middle of the night to watch this ceremony and in many ways, this really is a tiny personal story that played out in a sea forest at the very tip of Africa.
tsn: Ke a itse gore go na le Maaforikaborwa a mantsi a a sa robaleng mo gare ga bosigo go bogela moletlo o, mme ka ditsela di le dintsi, e ke e kgang e nnye ya sebele e e tlhageletseng kwa lewatleng le dikgwa kwa nkong ya Aforika.

en: But on a more universal level, I hope that it provided a glimpse of different types of relationships between human beings and the natural world.
tsn: Mme mo go botlhe , ke solofela fa e tlametse ka pono e nnye ya mefuta e e farologaneng ya botsalano magareng ga batho le tlhago.

en: Reed has called the win an honour and thanked the Academy and family for their support.
tsn: Reed o biditse phenyo e a re ke tlotlo, mme a leboga ba lelapa la akatemi ka tshegetso ya bona.

en: He also made special mention of the subject of the film, South African Craig Foster, who formed an underwater bond with the Octopus.
tsn: Gape o umakile rradifilimi, MoAforikaborwa Craig Foster, yo o agileng kgolagano ya kwa tlase ya metsi le Oketopase.

en: The documentary has already scooped a number of awards in 2020 including two wins at the Critics’ Choice Documentary Awards for Best Science/Nature Documentary and Best Cinematography.
tsn: Lenaneo le la tshedimosetso le setse le gapile dikgele di le dintsi mo ngwageng wa 2020 go akaretsa diphenyo di le pedi kwa Critics’ Choice Documentary Awards tsa sekgele sa ba ba gaisitseng mo go tsa saense/tlhago le mo go tsa dibaeskopo.

en: It also scooped the Grand Teton Award at the Jackson Wild Media Awards where it received 8 nominations.
tsn: Gape e iponetse sekgele sa Grand Teton kwa Jackson Wild Media Awards kwa e iponetseng gona ditlhopho di le 8.

en: It also won the Best Feature Film Award at the EarthX film festival.
tsn: Gape e ikgapetse sekgele sa filimi e e gaisang kwa moletlong wa Earthx film.

en: In the video below, My Octopus Teacher nominated for Oscar award:
tsn: Mo bidiong e e fa tlase, “My Octopus Teacher e ne newa sekgele sa Oscar.

en: Hollywood stars started arriving for the Academy Awards ceremony on Sunday on what could be a historic night packed with surprises, not just around the winners but the event itself.
tsn: Dinaledi tsa kwa Hollywood di simolotse go goroga ka nako ya moletlo wa dikgele tsa akatemi ka Sontaga, kwa go se e ka nnang motsi wa hisetori e e tletseng dikgagamatso , e seng fela go bafenyi mme le tiragalo ka boyone.

en: Sound of Metal first-time nominee Paul Raci was among the first to walk a scaled-down red carpet outside the Mission Revival-style Union Station in Los Angeles, which is being used for the first time because of the coronavirus pandemic.
tsn: Motlhophiwa wa ntlha Paul Raci, e ne e le mongwe wa  bantlha go tsamaya mo khapeteng e e khibidu kwa ntle ga seteišhene sa Revival-Style Union kwa Los Angeles, e e neng e dirisiwa lekgetlo la ntlha ka ntlha ya leroborobo la coronavirus.

en: Raci, who plays a mentor to a deaf drummer, used sign language on Sunday as he spoke to reporters and said he hoped the film had called attention to the deaf community.
tsn: Raci, yo o tshamekang karolo ya morutisi go moletsameropa wa susu, o dirisitse puo ya diatla ka Sontaga jaaka a ne a bua le babegadikgang mme a re o solofela fa filimi e e  dirile gore baagi ba bosusu ba kgone go bonwa.

en: Ma Rainey’s Black Bottom actor Colman Domingo sported ane on pink suit, while songwriter Diane Warren chose a white pantsuit with a sparkling turtleneck.
tsn: Modiragatsi wa Black Bottom ya ga Ma Rainey, Colman Domingo o ne a apere sutu e pinki ka mmala fa mokwaladipina Diane Warren ena a ne a itlhophetse sutu e tshweu ka sekipa se kganyang sa thamo e tshesane.

en: I’m here at the Oscars, Warren said.
tsn: Ke fano mo di Oscars, Warren ne a bolela jalo.

en: A more subdued Oscars but were still at the Oscars.
tsn: E ne e le di Oscar tse di bodutu, mme ba ne ba sa ntse ba le kwa di Oscars.

en: Social distancing and travel restrictions forced a complete rethink of the ceremony, which will be attended by just a few hundred nominees and presenters, including Brad Pitt and Harrison Ford, and held both outdoors and indoors at the Art Deco Union Station in Los Angeles.
tsn: Go katogana le dikganelo tsa metsamao di pateleditse gore ba akanye sešwa ka moletlo o, o o tlaa tsenelwang fela ke makgolo a le mmalwa a batho ba ba tlhophilweng le baneedi ba ba akaretsang Brad Pitt le Harrison Ford, mme o tlaa tshwarelwa kwa ntle, le ka mo gare kwa  Art Deco Union Station kwa Los Angeles.

en: Other nominees will join by satellite from international venues.
tsn: Batlhophiwa ba bangwe ba tlaa o tsenela ka sesupatshwantsho go tswa kwa mafelong  boditšhabatšhaba.

en: After strict testing and quarantine protocols, most celebrities were not wearing masks on the first major live red carpet after months of award shows on Zoom.
tsn: Morago ga melao e e gagametseng ya go dira diteko le go tlhaolelwa kwa thoko, bontsi jwa dinaledi ba ne ba sa apara dimaseke fa ne ba tsamaya mo khapeteng e kgolo e khibidu, morago ga dikgwedi meletlo ya dikgele e ntse e tshwarelwe mo Zoom.

en: We just want the whole thing, right out of the gate, to announce itself as being different, Steven Soderbergh, one of a trio of producers, said ahead of Sundays show.
tsn: Re e batla yotlhe, go simolola fela kwa kgorong, gore e ipontshe gore e farologane le tse dingwe, Steven Soderbergh, mongwe ba bantshakuno ba le bararo, o buile jalo pele ga moletlo wa Sontaga.

en: Hollywood’s drive for diversity over the past five years could lead to all four acting prizes, as well as the best director trophy, going to people of color for the first time in the 93-year history of the highest honors in the movie business.
tsn: Phisegelo ya Hollywood ya go bona mefuta e e farologaneng mo dingwageng tse tlhano tse di fetileng, e ka dira gore dikabelo tsotlhe di le nne, gammogo le sekgele sa mokaedi yo o gaisang, di ye kwa bathong ba mmala, la ntlha mo ngwageng wa bo 93, hisetori ya tlotlo e e kwa godimo mo kgwebong ya difilimi.

en: If Zhao, 39, wins best director, she will be only the second woman and the first Asian woman to clinch the Academy Award in that field.
tsn: Fa Zhao, 39, a ka gapa sekgele sa mokaedi yo o gaisang, e tlaa nna fela mosadi wa bobedi le mosadi wa moAsia wa ntlha go iponela sekgele sa akatemi mo karolong eo.

en: The Trial of the Chicago 7, which is set against the backdrop of the Vietnam War protests, is seen as the strongest challenger to Nomadland for best picture, awards experts say.
tsn: Tsheko ya Chicago 7, e e kgatlhanong le maemo a Vietnam, e bonwa e le kgwetlho e e masisi go Nomadland, ka sekgele sa setshwantsho se se gaisitseng, go bua baitseanape.

en: It is probably the most traditional Oscar movie.
tsn: E ka tswa e le yona filimi ya Oscar movie e e tlwaeleging thata.

en: It’s got a lot of big colourful performances and historical relevance, said Alison Willmore, film critic at New York magazine.
tsn: E na le ditiragalo tse dikgolo tse di itumedisang le hisetori e e maleba, go bua Alison Willmore, motshwayadiphoso wa difilimi kwa makasineng wa New York.

en: The other best picture nominees are 1930s Hollywood drama Mank, which led with 10 nominations; revenge tale Promising Young Woman, Korean immigrant family story Minari, civil rights biopic Judas and the Black Messiah, dementia tale The Father and Sound of Metal about a deaf drummer.
tsn: Batlhophiwa ba bangwe ba setshwantsho se se gaisitseng ke terama ya kwa Hollywood ya 1930, Mank, e e itlhomileng kwa pele ka ditlhopho di le 10; filimi ya ipusulesetso, Promising Young Woman, filimi ya lelapa le le fudugileng go tswa kwa Korea, Minari, filimi ka ga ditshwanelo tsa baagi, Judas and the Black Messiah, filimi ka ga bolwetse jwa go lebala, The Father le Sound of Metal, filimi ka ga moletsameropa wa susu.

en: The winners are chosen in a secret ballot by the 9,000 members of the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.
tsn: Bafenyi ba tlhophilwe ka tlhopho ya sephiri ke maloko a le 9,0000 a akatemi ya Motion Picture Arts & Sciences.

en: The race for lead actress is wide open, with Frances McDormand (Nomadland), Carey Mulligan (Promising Young Woman), Viola Davis (Ma Raineys Black Bottom), Vanessa Kirby (Pieces of a Woman) and Andra Day (The United States vs. Billie Holiday) competing for the prize.
tsn: Lebelo la modiragatsi wa mosadi yo o itlhomileng kwa pele le bulegile, go na le Frances McDormand (Nomadland), Carey Mulligan (Promising Young Woman), Viola Davis (Ma Raineys Black Bottom), Vanessa Kirby(Pieces of a Woman) le Andra Day (The United States vs. Billie Holiday)  ba ba gaisanelang sekgele se.

en: The best actress race is fascinating.
tsn: Lobelo lwa modiragatsi wa mosadi yo o gaisang le a kgatlhisa.

en: We’ve had a different winner in every televised awards show, said Pete Hammond, awards columnist at Deadline Hollywood.
tsn: Re nnile le mofenyi yo o farologaneng  mo moletlong yo mongwe le yo mongwe wa dikgele o o bontshiwang mo thelebišheneng, go bua Pete Hammond, mokwadi wa kholomo ya dikgele kwa Hollywood.

en: The late Black Panther star Chadwick Boseman, 43, appears to be in line for his first Oscar, for his final film role in Ma Raineys Black Bottom.
tsn: Naledi ya Black Panther e e tlogetseng lefatshe le le ka kwano, Chadwick Boseman, 43, ke mongwe wa ba batho ba ba ka gapang Oscar e, e le ka ntlha ya karolo e a e tshamekileng mo filiming ya ga Ma Rainey,  Black Bottom.

en: But Britain’s Anthony Hopkins, who plays a man struggling with dementia in The Father, could be rewarded, while Riz Ahmeds deaf punk drummer in Sound of Metal is seen as another possible best actor winner.
tsn: Fela Anthony Hopkins wa kwa Britain, yo o tshamekang karolo ya monna yo o nang le bolwetse jwa go lebala mo go The Father, a ka bona moputso, fa karolo ya moletsameropa wa susu ya ga Riz Ahmed mo Sound of the Metal e bonwa jaaka nngwe ya tse di ka ikgapelang moputso wa modiragatsi yo o gaisang.

en: For the first time since the pandemic struck, not one, but two movies brought in notable ticket sales at the domestic box office.
tsn: Lekgetlho la ntlha fa e sale go nna le leroborobo, e seng e le nngwe mme di le pedi tsa difilimi, di tlisitse dithekiso tse di bonalang kwa Box Office.

en: It’s the clearest indication yet that people appear ready to return to the movies after nearly a year of staying home to stream.
tsn: Ke sesupo se se ntle sa gore batho ba bontsha ba le malala a laotswe go boela kwa difiliming morago ga go dula kwa gae nako e e batlileng e lekana le ngwaga otlhe.

en: Mortal Kombat, a martial arts-inspired adaptation of the popular video game, led US box office charts, taking in a robust $22.5 million from 3 073 North American venues.
tsn: Mortal Kombat, e leng motshameko o o tlwaelegileng thata wa dibidio, o eteletse ditšhate tsa Box Office tsa kwa US kwa pele ka go ikgapela dimilione di le 22.5 tsa di dolara go tswa kwa mafelong a le 3 073 kwa Bokone jwa Amerika.

en: The Warner Bros. movie is already available to watch at home, on the streaming service HBO Max, for a month a strategy the studio is deploying for its entire 2021 slate.
tsn: Filimi ya The Warner Bros e setse e le teng go ka lebiwa kwa gae, mo tirelong ya HBO Max, kgwedi yotlhe, se ke togamaano e phaposikgaso e tlileng go e dirisa mo ngwageng wa 2021.

en: Though the R-rated Mortal Kombat easily cinched first place, it had more competition than it may have expected heading into the weekend.
tsn: Mortal Kombat e iponetse maemo a ntlha bonolo fela. E nnile le kgaisano e e fetang ka mokgwa o ba neng ba akantse ka ona fa go tsenwa mo mafelong a beke.

en: In a not-so-distant second, Demon Slayer
tsn: Mo maemong a bobedi a a tlogelang sekgala se se kalo, ke Demon Slayer.

en: Mugen Train earned a solid $15.9 million from 1 598 locations.
tsn: Mugen Train o amogetse madi a a kanang ka dimilione di le 15.9 go tswa kwa mafelong a a farologaneng a le 598 1.

en: South Africa’s COVID-19 cases amid the third wave has broken the 13 000 mark.
tsn: Dikgetse tsa Aforikaborwa tsa COVID-19 tsa lekhubu la boraro di fetile 13000 ka palo.

en: The Health Department says 13 246 cases were reported overnight, which represents a 21.7% positivity rate.
tsn: Lefapha la pholo le kaile fa go begilwe dikgetse di le 13 246 mo nakong e e khutshwane, se se isang palo ya ditswhaetsego go 21,7%

en: According to the National Institute for Communicable Diseases, this is the highest number of daily cases and positivity rate since January.
tsn: Go ya ka setheo sa bosetšhaba sa malwetse a a tshelanwang, e ke palo e e kwa godimo ya dikgetse tsa letsatsi le letsatsi fa e sale ka Ferikgong.

en: Health activist Dr Kgosi Letlape reacts to rising COVID-19 numbers: The country now has 1 774 312 coronavirus cases since the outbreak of the pandemic in March 2020.
tsn: Mokgaratlhi wa tsa boitekanelo Ngaka Kgosi Letlape  tsibogela go tlhatloga ga dipalo tsa covid-19:

en: Hundred and 36 new fatalities were reported overnight, taking the total national death toll to 58 223.
tsn: Go ne ga begwa dintsho di le 136 mo nakong e e khutshwane, se se isa palogotlhe ya bosetšhaba ya dintsho go 58 223.

en: The NICD is urging South Africans to remain vigilant and follow prevention measures as diligent as possible to help stop the spread.
tsn: NICD e rotloetsa Maaforikaborwa go nna kelotlhoko le go latela dikgato tsa thibelo ka manontlhotlho go thusa go thibela kanamo.

en: It is also calling on young South Africans to assist the elderly register for vaccinations.
tsn: E ikuela gape go bašwa ba Aforikaborwa go thusa bagodi go ikwadisetsa mokento.

en: So far, 1 965 812 South Africans have received their COVID-19 shots.
tsn: Go fitlha ga jaana,  Maaforikaborwa a le 1 965 812 a setse a amogetse mokento wa COVID-19.

en: Nigeria is expecting a second shipment of nearly 4 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines by early august, and plans to resume giving out first doses, which had been halted to save its supply for second doses.
tsn: Nigeria e solofetse kgorogo ya bobedi ya selekanyo sa dimilione di le 4 sa mokento wa COVID-19 kwa tshimologong ya kgwedi ya Phatwe, mme ba ikaelela go tswelela pele ka go fana ka selekanyo sa ntlha sa meento se se neng se emisitswe go boloka tlamelo ya selekanyo sa bobedi.

en: Africa’s most populous nation has so far given the first dose to only around 2 million of its 200 million people.
tsn: Go fitlha ga jaana, naga ya Aforika e e nang le boidiidi jwa batho e setse e file fela batho ba ka nna dimilione di le 2 mo go ba le dimilione di le 200 selekanyo sa ntlha.

en: Nigeria has been rationing 3.92 million doses it received through the COVAX global vaccine sharing programme in March, with its future supplies put in doubt by an export ban from India.
tsn: Nigeria e ntse e abelana ka selekanyo sa dimilione di le 3.92 tse ba di amogetsweng ka porogerama ya COVAX ya kabelano ya mekento ya lefatshe ka bophara  ka Mopitlwe, ka ditlamelo tse di tlang di santse di beilwe mo kakabalong ka ntlha ya thibelo ya thomelontle ya dithoto go tswa kwa India.

en: Nigeria now expects the second shipment of 3.92million doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine by the end of July or early August.
tsn: Nigeria jaanong e lebeletse kgorogo ya bobedi ya selekanyo sa dimilione di le 3.92 sa moento wa AstraZeneca wa COVID-19 kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi ya Phukwi kgotsa ka tshimologo ya kgwedi ya Phatwe.

en: Vaccination centres will be reopened to adults over the age of 18 seeking first doses, he said.
tsn: Ditikwatikwe tsa moento di tlaa bulwa gape di bulelwa bagolo ba ba fetang dingwaga di le 18 ba ba batlang selekanyo sa ntlha, a rialo.

en: We have been inundated with requests by Nigerians to be vaccinated, Shuaib said at a media briefing in Abuja.
tsn: Re ntse re amogela dikopo di le dintsi tsa batho ba ba tswang kwa Nigerian ba ba batlang go entiwa, shuaib obuile kwa kopanong ya bobegakgang kwa Abuja...

en: He did not specify where the new doses would come from but pointed to a commitment last week by G7 leaders to deliver at least 1 billion coronavirus vaccine doses to the world over the next year.
tsn: Ga a a tlhalosa gore meento e mentšhwa e tlaa tswa kae mme o supile boineelo mo bekeng e e fetileng jwa baeteledipele ba G7 jwa go neelana ka mekento ya mogare wa Corona e ka nna selekanyo sa bilione e le 1 lefatshe lotlhe mo ngwageng o o tlang.

en: Vaccine hesitancy rooted in misinformation is also a problem.
tsn: Go okaoka ka moento go go bakiwang ke tshedimosetso e e fosagetseng  le gona ke bothata.

en: The Democratic Nursing Organisation of South Africa (Denosa) says it feels disappointed by President Cyril Ramaphosa’s address to the nation on Tuesday regarding governments response to the increase of coronavirus infections in the country.
tsn: Setheo sa booki sa temokerasi ya Aforikaborwa (Denosa) sa re se ikutlwa se swabisitswe ke puo e e dirilweng ke Moporesidente Cyril ramaphosa fa a ne a bua le setšhaba ka Labobedi malebana le go ikarabela ga puso ka ga koketsego ya ditshwaetsego tsa mogare wa Corona mo nageng.

en: Denosa says it had hoped the President would announce stricter regulations to curb the spread of the virus.
tsn: Denosa ya re e ne e solofetse fa moporesitente a ka dira melawana e e gagametseng go fedisa go anama ga mogare.

en: Denosa’s acting general-secretary, Cassim Lekhoathi, says nurses are overwhelmed by the workload in hospitals because of the increased number of COVID-19 patients, and that more nurses are dying from the virus.
tsn: Mokwaledi kakaretso wa nakwana wa Denosa Cassim Lekhoathi, a re baoki ba fekeetswa ke tiro e ntsi kwa maokelong ka ntlha ya koketsego ya palo ya balwetse ba COVID-19, le gore baoki ba le ntsi ba a tlhokafala ka ntlha ya mogare.

en: Patients are increasing and the number of staff are decreasing because there is no replacement as we bury, like this weekend I am going to bury three of our nurses, they are not going to be replaced.
tsn: Balwetse ba a oketsega mme palo ya badiri e a  fokotsega ka ntlha ya gore ga go ope yo o tsenang mo maemong a ba re bolokang, jaaka mafelo a beke ke tlile go boloka ba le bararo ba baoki ba rona, ga go ope yo o tlileng go tsena mo maemong a bona.

en: And I am not just talking about those that I am going to bury this weekend, I am talking about those who are already infected who are in isolation, and the few that have to remain behind in the wards, they have to carry on with the load.
tsn: Mme ga ke bue fela ka ba ke yang go ba bolokang mafelo a beke, ke bua ka ga ba ba setseng ba tshwaetsegileng mme ba kgapetswe kwa thoko, le ba le mmalwa ba ba tshwanetseng go sala kwa diwotong, ba tshwanetse go tswelela pele ka morwalo.

en: Many healthcare workers have received the Johnson and Johnson vaccine.
tsn: Badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba le bantsi ba amogetse moento wa Johnson & Johnson.

en: South Africa moves to lockdown alert level 3:
tsn: Aforikaborwa e ya kwa legatong la boraro la kiletsomesepele.

en: A total of 339 healthcare workers died of COVID-19 related illness in South Africa between March and November last year, with most deaths occurring in the Eastern Cape, KwaZulu-Natal and Gauteng
tsn: Palogotlhe ya badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba le 339 ba tlhokafetse ka ntlha ya malwetse a a amanang le COVID-19 mo Aforikaborwa fa gare ga kgwedi ya Mopitlwe le ya Ngwanaitseele mo ngwageng o o fetileng, mme bontsi jwa dintsho tse di diragetse kwa Kapa Botlhaba, KwaZulu-Natal le Gauteng.

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa says despite the setbacks with the COVID-19 vaccine roll out in the country, the pace is picking up with up to 85 000 people now being vaccinated daily.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa a re le fa go nnile le dikgoreletsi ka go ntshiwa ga moento wa COVID-19  mo nageng, dipalo di ntse di ya kwa godimo ka fa go entiwa batho ba le 85 000  letsatsi le letsatsi.

en: Government has also received an indication from Johnson and Johnson that the 2 million doses that had to be destroyed at Aspens plant in Gqeberhawill be replaced by the end of the month.
tsn: Puso e amogetse e e tswang kwa go Johnson & Johnson ya gore dimilione di le 2 tse di neng di ntse di tshwanetseng go senngwa kwa Aspens kwa Qqeberha di tla busediwa kwa bokhutlong jwa kgwedi.

en: Ramaphosa says a statistic that provides hope is that only 64 healthcare workers have been infected in the last seven days compared to 640 at a similar point in the second wave.
tsn: Ramaphosa a re  dipalopalo tse di tlisang tsholofelo ke tsa gore ke badiri ba tlhokomelo ya boitekanelo ba le 64 fela ba ba tshwaetsegileng mo malatsing a le supa a a fetileng fa go bapisiwa le 640 gwa go ne go simolola lekhubu la bobedi.

en: South Africa moves to lockdown alert level 3: Meanwhile, DA leader John Steenhuisen has criticised the pace of the country’s vaccination programme, saying governments plans to innoculate a large percentage of the nation are not yet clear.
tsn: Aforikaborwa e tswelela pele go ya kwa logatong lwa boraro lwa kiletsomesepele: Re sa ntse re le foo, moeteledipele wa DA John Steenhuisen o tshwaile diphoso lebelo la naga la moento, a re maikaeleo a puso a go enta peresente e kgolo ya setšhaba ga a ise a bonale.

en: The president said while the vaccination programme was gaining momentum, South Africa was far from reaching population immunity.
tsn: Moporesidente o rile fa porokerama ya moento e okeditse lebelo, Aforikaborwa e santse e le kgakala le go fitlhelela seemo se se tla thusang masole a mmele a baagi go lwantsha bolwetse morago ga moento.

en: Steenhuisen has raised questions over governments pace in procuring vaccines.
tsn: Steenhuisen o tsositse dipotso ka ga lebelo le puso e rekang ka lona meento.

en: I think government has a lot to answer for.
tsn: Ke akanya gore puso e na le dipotso di le dintsi tse e tshwanetseng go di araba.

en: The president is very good at throwing out big numbers but never explaining how we are going to get there.
tsn: Moporesidente o na le bokgoni jwa go gorometsa dipalo tse dikgolo mme a sa tlhalosa gore re tla di fitlhelela jang.

en: There is clearly a problem with governments procurement of the vaccine that has left many South Africans at great risk of contracting the virus.
tsn: Go tota go na le mathata ka tsela eo puso e rekang meento ka teng,  Seo se tsentse Maaforikaborwa a mantsi mo kotsing e kgolo ya go tlhaselwa ke mogare.

en: It would not have been if we had a successful vaccination programme.
tsn: Go ne go se kitla go nna jalo fa re ne re na le lenaneo la go entiwa le le atlegileng.

en: Some people will pay for governments failure with their lives.
tsn: Batho ba bangwe ba tla duelela go palelwa ga puso ka matshelo a bona.

en: The Health Departments Director General, Dr Sandile Buthelezi, says the health sector is better-prepared for further hospital admissions amid the third wave of the coronavirus.
tsn: Mokaedi kakaretso wa lefapha la boitekanelo, Ngaka Sandile Buthelezi a re setheo se ipaakenyeding kamogelo ya balwete ba bangwe kwa bookelong mo nakong ya lekhubu la boraro la coronavirus.

en: President Cyril Ramaphosa made the announcement on Tuesday night that the country had moved to lockdown level 3.
tsn: Moporesidente Cyril Ramaphosa o dirile kitsiso ka Labobedi bosigo ya gore naga ga jaana e mo kemong ya boraro ya kiletsomesepele.

en: He has raised concerns over several provinces reporting a consistent rise in COVID-19 infections  with Gauteng being the worst hit.
tsn: O bontshitse matshwenyego ka diporofenseng tse di farologaneng tse di begang tlhatlogo ya ditshwaetsego tsa COVID-19, Gauteng e le yona e e amegileng thata.

en: Buthelezi says the health sector has taken lessons from the first and second wave of the coronavirus on ways to treat patients:
tsn: Buthelezi a re setheo sa boitekanelo se tsere malebela go tswa mo lekhubung la ntlha le la bobedi la coronavirus a ditsela tsa go alafa balwetse

en: I think we have learned quite a lot from the 1st and 2nd waves.
tsn: Ke akanya gore re setse re ithutile go le gontsi go feta ka lekhubu la ntlha le la bobedi.

en: Certain provinces are taking strain such as Gauteng.
tsn: Diporofense tse dingwe di imetswe le go feta, jaaka le Gauteng.

en: South Africa has recorded 8 436new COVID-19 cases, taking the total number of infections to 1 761 066.
tsn: Aforikaborwa e begile dikgetse di le 8 436 tsa COVID-19 tse dintšhwa, se se isang palogotlhe ya ditshwaetso go 1 761 066

en: Two hundred and eight COVID-19-related deaths were also reported in the last 24-hour cycle, pushing the national death toll to 58 087.
tsn: Go begilwe dikgetse di le 208 tsa dintsho tse di bakilweng ke COVID-19 mo di ureng di le 24 tse di fetileng, se se isa palo ya bosetšhaba ya loso go 58 087.

en: The President briefed the nation on Tuesday night after a meeting with various stakeholders, including the National Coronavirus Command Council.
tsn: Moporesitente o boleletse setšhaba ka Labobedi bosigo morago ga pitso le bannaleseabe ba ba farologaneng, go akaretsa le lekgotla la bosetšhaba la coronavirus.

en: The Department of Mineral Resources and Energy (DMRE) has dispatched a task team to the area of KwaHlathi near Ladysmith in KwaZulu-Natal to conduct a proper inspection of a site where stones believed to be diamonds have been found.
tsn: Lefapha la Diminerale le Maatla (DMRE) le rometse setlhopha sa badiri kwa lefelong la KwaHlathi gaufi le Ladysmith kwa KwaZulu-Natal go dira tlhatlhobo e e tlhomameng ya lefelo leo matlapa a a ne a dumela go nna diteemane a fitlhetsweng teng.

en: The task team includes geological and mineral experts.
tsn: Setlhopha se sa badiri se akaretsa bomankge ba jioloji le ba tsa diminerale.

en: News of the purported discovery of diamonds spread across the country on Friday and people are still flocking to the area to dig for the stones.
tsn: Dikgang tsa thibololo ya diteemane di ile tsa anama go ralala naga ka Labotlhano mme batho ba sa ntse ba thologela kwa lefelong leo go ya go epa matlapa.

en: The team from DMRE is expected to be on site from Tuesday and that will include the Departments Enforcement and Compliance unit to conduct an inspection of the site.
tsn: Setlhopha sa go tswa kwa DMRE se solofetswe go fitlha kwa lefelong ka Labobedi mme se tlaa akaretsa le ba setlhopha sa tlhomamiso le tiragatso go ya go dira tlhatlhobo ya lefelo.

en: The team also includes experts from the Council for Mineral Technology (Mintek) and the Council for Geoscience who can give an opinion about the mineral composition of rocks, and can provide an analysis of an areas potential for mineral resources, respectively.
tsn: Setlhopha gape se akaretsa baitseanape go tswa go lekgotla la diminerale le thekenoloji (MINTEK) le lekgotla la Disaense tsa thutafatshe (GeoScience) ba ba tlaa neelaang ka dikakanyo tsa bona ka ga tlholego ya matlapa, le go neelana ka tshekatsheko ya go nna teng ga didiriswa tsa diminerale mo lefelong leo.

en: After the analysis, a formal technical report will be issued in due course.
tsn: Morago ga tshekatsheko ya setegeniki, pegelo e tla neelwa mo nakong e e tlang.

en: The traditional communities, local and district municipalities, have been asked to restore calm to the area.
tsn: Baagi ba selegae le kgaolo ya Bommasepala mo lefelong leo, ba kopilwe go ritibatsa maikutlo.

en: The community of KwaHlathi say if it is realdiamonds, Black people must get first preference in terms of economic opportunities.
tsn: Baagi ba KwaHlathi ba re fa e le gore ke ditaemane tsa nnete, batho ba bantsho ba tshwanetse go bewa kwa pele fa go tliwa mo ditšhonong tsa ikonomi.

en: The residents add that the discovery of the stones goes to show the value of a field of study like Geology.
tsn: Baagi ba oketsa ka gore thibololo ya matlapa a e bontsha boleng jwa dithuto tse di tshwanang le Jeoloji.

en: So, they must start now to study these studies (sic), says community member, Thabani Mbatha.
tsn: Ka jalo, ba tshwanetse go simolola jaanong go ithuta dithuto tse (sic), go bua leloko la baagi, Thabani Mbatha.

en: Another resident, Vuma Makhwasa, says: The status of the area is likely to change socially and economically if it is real gold.
tsn: Moagi mongwe, Vuma Makhwasa, a re: Maemo a kgaolo a ka fetoga thata mo loagong le mo ikonoming fa e le gore ke gauta ya nnete.

en: But the government must make sure that Black people are not only employees, but they have equal shares, as a means of economic empowerment.
tsn: Mme puso e tshwanetse go netefatsa gore batho ba bantsho ga se fela badiri, mme ba nna le dišere, jaaka tsela ya matlafatso ya ikonomi.

en: People are literally picking up diamonds from the ground in KZN, Ladysmith, KwaHlathi.
tsn: Batho ba tsweletse go sela diteemane go tswa mo mmung kwa KZN, Ladysmith le KwaHlathi...

en: The National Institute for Communicable Diseases (NICD) has released the latest coronavirus data which shows that Gauteng accounts for more than two-thirds of the new cases.
tsn: Setheo sa bosetšhaba sa malwetse a a tshelanwang (NICD) se golotse tshedimosetso ya mogare wa corona e e supang gore Gauteng e begile dikgetse tse di fetang peditharong tse dintšhwa.

en: Gauteng has registered over 3 700 new coronavirus cases of the national figure of over 5 500.
tsn: Gauteng e kwadisitse dikgetse tse di fetang 3 700 tse dintšhwa tsa mogare wa corona mo palong ya bosetšhaba ya dikgetse tse di fetang 5 500.

en: South Africa entered the third wave of the pandemic just over a week ago.
tsn: Aforikaborwa e tsene mo lekhubung la boraro la leroborobo mo bekeng e e fetileng.

en: Unpacking increasing COVID-19 cases in Gauteng with Prof. Bruce Mellado:
tsn: Re ranolola dintlha tsa koketsego ya dikgetse tsa COVID-19 mo Gauteng le Moporof. Bruce Mellado..

en: The South African pharmaceutical manufacturer, Aspen, says it is taking steps to mitigate the loss of the Johnson and Johnson vaccines stored at its Gqeberha plant in the Eastern Cape.
tsn: Khemisi ya Aforikaborwa, Aspen, ya re e tsaya dikgato go fokotsa tatlhegelo ya meento ya Johnson le Johnson e e bolokilweng kwa Qqeberha kwa Kapa Botlhaba.

en: The manufacturer says Johnson and Johnson will, within days, provide 300 000 doses of the vaccine for South African teachers.
tsn: Motlamedi a re Johnson & Johnson e tlaa tlamela barutabana ba Aforikaborwa ka selekanyo sa meento e le 300 000 mo malatsing a a tlang.

en: Aspen adds that within a week it expects to release Johnson and Johnson vaccines manufactured from ingredients that are not impacted by the contamination of vaccines in the US.
tsn: Aspen e tlaleletsa ka gore mo bekeng e solofetse go golola meento ya Johnson & Johnson e e tlhamilweng ka ditswaki tse di mafolofolo tse di sa amiweng ke kgotlhelo ya meento kwa US.

en: The company says it is also busy producing more doses of the vaccine that are set to be available in July.
tsn: Setlamo se sa re se ntse se tsweletse go dira meento e mengwe e e tlaa nnang teng ka kgwedi ya Phukwi.

en: The vaccines were affected by contamination issues at a US vaccine plant in Baltimore.
tsn: Meento e ne e amilwe ke mathata a kgotlelego kwa US kwa Baltimore.

en: On Sunday, government and the South African Health Products Regulatory Authority (Sahpra) assured South Africans that the contaminated doses will not be released in the country.
tsn: Ka La tshipi, Puso le setheo sa taolo ya didiriswa tsa boitekanelo sa Aforikaborwa (Sahpra) ba tlhomamiseditse Maaforikaborwa gore meento e e kgotlelegileng ga e kitla e gololwa mo nageng ya rona.

en: Sahpra CEO, Dr Boitumelo Semete-Makokotlela speaking about contaminated J&J vaccines:
tsn: Moeteledipele wa Sahpra, Ngaka Boitumelo Semete-Makokotlela buile ka go kgotlelega ga meento ya J & J.

en: The company’s move follows reports that some batches waiting to be distributed from the Gqeberha Aspen plant had been contaminated.
tsn: Kgato ya setlamo se e latela morago ga dipego tsa gore mekoa e e neng e emetseng go abiwa go tswa kwa Aspen ya kwa Qgqeberha e kgotlelegile

en: The two main hospitals treating people with COVID-19 in Afghanistan have had to close their doors to new patients because of a lack of beds, a senior health official and doctors said on Monday.
tsn: Maokelo a mabedi a a alafang batho ba ba nang le COVID-19 kwa Afghanistan  a ne a tshwanelwa ke go tswala dikgoro tsa ona ka ntlha ya tlhokego ya malao.Motlhankedimogolo wa boitekanelo le dingaka ba buile jalo ka Mosupologo.

en: Afghanistan is grappling with a third wave of the pandemic, with a record number of infections and deaths being reported amid a surge in violence as US-led international forces withdraw and Taliban insurgents go on the offensive.
tsn: Afghanistan e lebane le lekhubu la boraro la leroborobo, ka palo ya d65.itshwaetsego le ya dintsho tse di begwang gareng ga koketsego ya dintwa fa batlhabani ba boditšhabatšhaba ba US ba ikgogela kwa morago mme  bamenola-puso ba kwa Taliban ba kgopisega.

en: Both Afghan Japan and Ali Jinnah hospitals had to close their doors because they had no more beds or resources, the health official said on condition of anonymity as they were not authorised to speak publicly about the matter.
tsn: Maokelo a Afghan Japan le Ali Jinnah a ne a tshwanelwa ke go tswala dikgoro tsa ona ka ntlha ya tlhokego ya malao kgotsa didiriswa. Motlhankedi wa tsa boitekanelo o buile jalo mme a kopa go nna tlhokaina jaaka ba ne ba sa dumelelwa go bua mo phatlhalatseng ka ga kgang e.

en: The official said the two hospitals, both in the capital Kabul, were facing persistent shortages of oxygen and other medical supplies.
tsn: Motlhankedi o rile maokelo a bobedi jwa ona a leng mo khepetleleng ya Kabul a ne a tswelela go nna le mathata a tlhaelo ya okesijene le tse dingwe tsa kalafi.

en: Mirwais Alizay, deputy health ministry spokesperson, said hospitals had close sometimes due to higher patient numbers
tsn: Mirwais Alizay, Motlatsa mmueledi wa Lefapha la Boitekanelo, o rile maokelo a a tshwanelwa ke go tswalwa ka dinako dingwe ka ntlha ya dipalo tse di kwa godimo tsa balwetse.

en: Masi Noori, a doctor at Afghan Japan hospital, said it had been closed to new patients for several days because it had run out of beds.
tsn: Masi Noori, Ngaka kwa bookelong jwa  Afghan Japan, o rile e ne e tswaletswe balwetse ba bašwa mo malatsing a le mmalwa ka ntlha ya tlhaelo ya malao.

en: Eid Wali, head of Ali Jinnah hospital, said it had to stop taking new patients when its COVID-19 beds were full.
tsn: Eid Wali, tlhogo ya bookelo jwa Ali Jinnah, o rile ba ne ba tshwanelwa ke emisa go tsaya balwetse ba bašwa fa malao a bona a COVID-19 a ne a tletse.

en: We only have 50 beds for COVID cases, that’s the main problem, Wali told Reuters.
tsn: Re na fela le malao a le 50 a dikgetse tsa COVID, ke jona bothata jo bogolo joo, Wali a bolelela Reuters.

en: Afghanistan reported on Monday 1 804 new COVID-19 cases and 71 deaths from the disease.
tsn: Afghanistan e begile ka Mosupologo dikgetse di le 1 804 tse dintšhwa tsa COVID-19 le dintsho di le 71 tse di bakilweng ke bolwetse.

en: Human rights group Amnesty International said last week the government needed to immediately procure more oxygen and vaccines.
tsn: Setlhopha sa ditshwanelo tsa botho le tokololo ya boditšhabatšhaba se buile mo bekeng e e fetileng gore puso e tlhoka go reka okosijene le meento ka bonako.

en: Afghanistan’s COVID-19 case numbers have been steadily increasing, said Zaman Sultani, the groups South Asia researcher.
tsn: Dipalo tsa dikgetse tsa COVID-19 kwa Afghanistan di ntse di oketsega, go buile Zaman Sultani, mmatlisisi wa ditlhopha tsa Borwa jwa Asia. (South Asia).

en: Last week, Afghanistan received 700 000 doses of a COVID-19 vaccine made by Chinas Sinopharm.
tsn: Mo bekeng e e fetileng, Afghanistan e amogetse selekanyo sa meento ya COVID-19 e le 700 000 e e dirilweng ke sinopharm ya kwa China.

en: Health experts say the shortages of vaccine doses in South Africa pose a big challenge in terms of the roll-out programme.
tsn: Baitseanape ba tsa boitekanelo ba re tlhaelo ya meento mo Aforikaborwa e ntse e le kgwetlho e kgolo go ya ka porokerama ya go simolola go enta.

en: Epidemiologist Professor Salim Abdool Karim says the Johnson and Johnson batches that have been disposed off is a major blow to the country’s efforts to increase the number of vaccinations per day.
tsn: Ngaka ya malwetse a a anamang Moporofesara Salim Abdool Karim a re mekoa ya Johnson & Johnson e e latlhilwe e buseditse kwa morago maiteko a naga a go oketsa palo ya mekento ka letsatsi.

en: Sahpra CEO Dr Boitumelo Semete-Makokotlela is pleading with South Africans not to panic as there are emergency plans in place.
tsn: Moeteledipele wa Sahpra Ngaka Boitumelo Semete-Makokotlela o ikuela go Maaforikaborwa gore ba seke ba tshoga ka ntlha ya fa go na le dithulaganyo tsa tshoganyetso.

en: Sahpra confirmed that 300 000 doses that have been approved by the US Food & Drug Administration will be released for shipment to SA.
tsn: Sahpra e netefaditse gore melemo e le 300 000 e e amogetsweng ke ba tsamaiso le diritibatsi kwa US e tlaa gololwa mme ya romelwa kwa SA.

en: The Johnson & Johnson vaccine will now be stored for four-and-half months instead of three months  at a temperature of 2.8 degrees Celsius.
tsn: Moento wa Johnson & Johnson moento o tlaa bolokwa dikgwedi di le dine le halofo mo boemong jwa dikgwedi tse tharo ka mot lase ga themphereitšha ya 2.8 didikerii selisiase.

en: Retired geologist from Durban, Manqoba Msimango, says he cannot rule out the authenticity of the recent discovery of what some believe to be diamonds in the KwaHlathi area outside Ladysmith in KwaZulu-Natal.
tsn: Mojeoloji yo o rotseng tiro wa kwa Durban, Manqoba Msimango, a re ga a kake a kgapela kwa thoko boammaaruri jwa thibololo ya bošeng jaana ya se batho bangwe ba ne ba dumela gore ke diteemane kwa lefelong la KwaHlathi kwa ntle ga Ladysmith kwa KwaZulu-Natal.

en: Msimang says only a team of geologists can confirm if these are indeed diamonds.
tsn: Msimang a re ke setlhopha sa bajioloji fela se se ka tlhomamisang fa dilo tse e le diteemane tsa nnete.

en: The South African Health Products Regulatory Authority (Sahpra) as well as the Acting Minister of Health Mmamoloko Kubayi-Ngubane have assured South Africans that the contaminated COVID-19 vaccine doses will not be released in South Africa.
tsn: Setheo sa taolo ya didiriswa tsa boitekanelo sa Aforikaborwa (sahpra) gammogo le tona ya tsa boitekanelo ya nakwana Mmamoloko Kubayi-Ngubane  ba netefaleditse Maaforikaborwa gore moento o o kgotlelegileng wa COVID-19 ga o kitla o gololwa mo Aforikaborwa.

en: This after it emerged that some batches waiting to be distributed from the Gqeberha Aspen plant in the Eastern Cape had been contaminated.
tsn: Se ke morago ga go lemoga gore mekoa e e letileng go abiwa go tswa kwa  Aspen e e kwa Gqeberha kwa Kapa Botlhaba e kgotlelegile.

en: Based on what has been announced by the FDA we are affected in terms of those batches there at Gqeberha site and what we have there on site is 2 million.
tsn: Go ya ka se se begilweng ke FDA re a amega fa go tliwa mo mokoeng e e kwa Gqeberha mme  e re nang le yona kwa lifelong leo e dimilione di le 2 ka palo.

en: I think South African citizens should not panic and what we will receive and use, would be approved.
tsn: Ke akanya gore baagi ba Aforikaborwa ga ba a tshwanela go tshoga mme se re tlaa se amogelang le go se dirisa, se tlabe se letlelesegile.

en: The US Food and Drug Authority (FDA) halted the release of all J&J vaccines from the plant pending an investigation.
tsn: Setlamo sa dijo le diritibatsi sa kwa US (FDA) se emisitse kgololo ya meento ya J & J fa go santse go letilwe dipatlisiso.

en: Countries should avoid giving the AstraZeneca coronavirus vaccine to people over 60, the head of the EU drug regulators COVID-19 task force was quoted on Sunday as saying, amid fears over rare blood clotting and as more vaccines become available.
tsn: Dinaga di tshwanetse go tila go naya moento wa AstraZeneca wa coronavirus go batho ba ba fetang 60 ka dingwaga, tlhogo ya EU ya balaodi ba diritibatsi ya covid-19 o ne a nopolwa ka La tshipi fa a a rialo, magareng ga poifo e e leng teng ka ga madi a a remang fa emento e mengwe e ntse e nna teng.

en: The European Medicines Agency (EMA) considers the AstraZeneca shot safe for all age groups.
tsn: Setheo sa Mayuropa sa melemo (EMA) se tsaya AstraZeneca jaaka moento o o babalesegileng go batho ba dingwaga tsotlhe.

en: The Italian government said on Friday it would restrict the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine to people aged over 60, after a teenager who had received the shot died from a rare form of blood clotting.
tsn: Puso ya kwa Italy e rile ka Labotlhano e tlaa fokotsa tiriso ya moento wa AstraZeneca go batho ba ba fetang dingwaga di le 60, morago ga gore ngwana yo o neng a amogetse moento o a tlhokafale ka ntlha ya go rema ga madi.

en: Like many European countries, Italy briefly halted AstraZeneca inoculations in March over concerns about the rare blood clotting problems.
tsn: Jaaka dinaga tse dintsi tsa Yuropa, Italy e emisitse ka boripana meento ya AstraZeneca ka Mopitlwe ka ntlha ya matshwenyego ka ga mathata a go rema ga madi.

en: South Africa and India, backed by many emerging nations, want a temporary waiver of IP rights on vaccines and other treatments to allow local manufacturers to produce shots.
tsn: Aforikaborwa le India, ba tshegeditswe ke dinaga di le dintsi tse di santseng di gola, ba batla tlogelo ya nakwana ya ditshwanelo tsa IP tsa meento le dikalafi tse dingwe go letla badiri ba selegae go dira meento.

en: US President Joe Biden has said he backs a temporary waiver.
tsn: Moperesitente wa kwa US Joe Biden o rile o tshegetsa tlogelo ya nakwana.

en: Okonjo-lweala said the debate had moved ahead with the agreement to start the negotiations.
tsn: Okonjo-lweala o rile ngangisano e tsamaetse kwa pele ka tumalano ya go simolola dipuisano.

en: WTO members are due to discuss next week the format of negotiations with a view to producing a report by July 21-22.
tsn: Ditokololo tsa WTO di tshwanetse go buisana mo bekeng e e tlang ka ga mokgwa wa ditherisano ka maikaelelo a go kwala pegelo ka Phukwi 21-22..

en: The G7 leaders, holding a summit in south west England, agreed on Friday to donate 1 billion COVID-19 vaccine doses to poorer countries, something the United Nations and campaign groups said fell short of what is needed.
tsn: Baeteledipele ba G7, ba na neng ba tshwere Samiti kwa Borwa Bophirima jwa England, ba dumalane ka Labotlhano go aba mento ya COVID-19 e le bilione e le 1  go dinaga tse di humanegileng, sengwe se se United Nations le ditlhopha tsa  letsholo di rileng se a tlhokega.

en: Separately, Okonjo-Iweala said she was  hoping for a significant advance in talks on fishery subsidies by July even if we dont get to a conclusion which is quite possible.
tsn: Kwa thoko, Okonjo-lweala o rile o ne a solofetse gore dipuisano ka ga dikeetso tsa bodirelatlhapi di tlaa direga ka kgwedi ya Phukwi le fa go na le kgonego ya gore re seke ra fitlhelela bokhutlo.

en: She is due to host a meeting of WTO member countries on July15 to try to cut fisheries subsidies after 20 years of talks.
tsn: O tile go tshwara kopano ya WTO ya dinaga ka 15 Phukwi go leka go fokotsa diketleetso tsa bodirelatlhapi morago ga dingwaga di le 20 tsa dipuisano.

en: The month of June is no ordinary month in South Africa, especially for its youth.
tsn: Kgwedi ya Seetebosigo ga e se kgwedi e e tlwaelegileng mo Aforikaborwa, segolo go bašwa ba yone.

en: It is a reminder of the Heroes and Heroines of 1976, who made history during this month.
tsn: Ke kgakololo ka ga bagaka le bagakagadi ba 1976, ba ba dirileng hisetori mo kgweding eno.

en: The 16th of June 1976 South Africa saw an uprising where thousands of students in Soweto started a march against the Bantu Education System, which compelled Black student to learn in Afrikaans.
tsn: Ka di 16 tsa kgwedi ya Seetebosigo 1976 Aforikaborwa e ne ya bona dikhuduego fa diketekete tsa baithuti kwa Soweto di simolola mogwanto o o leng kgatlhanong le tsamaiso ya thuto ya Bantsho, e e neng e pateletsa. baithuti go ithuta ka Afrikaans.

en: On the fateful day of June, students were to have a peaceful march to Orlando Stadium as a sign of resistance against the new language policy.
tsn: Ka letsatsi leo la ditiragalo la kgwedi ya Seetebosigo, baithuti ba ne ba tshwanetse go tshwara mogwanto o o nang le kagiso  go ya kwa lebaleng la metshameko la Orlando jaaka letshwao la go nna kgatlhanong le pholisi ya puo e ntšhwa.

en: However, events did not turn out as expected and these particular events made the month of June what it is in SA today.
tsn: Le fa go le jalo, ditiragalo ga di a tsamaya jaaka go ne go solofetswe mme ditiragalo tse di dirile kgwedi ya Seetebosigo se e leng sona mo Aforikaborwa gompieno.

en: Although it is a month where we commemorate the bravery and victory of the 1976 youth, South Africa's youth is still faced with challenges.
tsn: Le fa e le kgwedi e ka yone re ketekang bopelokgale le phenyo ya  bašwa ba 1976, Aforikaborwa e sa ntse e lebagane le dikgwetlho.

en: I venerate the youth of 1976 for their relentless vaulor and guidance for which they left for generations thereafter.
tsn: Ke lebisa tlotlo go bašwa ba 1976 ka bogaka le kaelo e e tsepameng e ba e tlogeletseng ba ba tlang kwa morago.

en: Challenges facing South-African youth today span from a number of elements dealt with domestically varying from the corruption scourge to the youth having little or no faith in governance (Patel; Graham: 2019).
tsn: Dikgwetlho tse di lebaganeng bašwa ba Aforikaborwa gompieno dibakilwe ke dilo di le mmalwa tse di farologaneng go tswa mo go lwantsheng bosenyi go ya tumelo e nnye e bašwa ba nang le yona mo mmusong (Patel; Ga Graham: 2019).

en: In February, SA youth aged 15-24 years recorded a high unemployment rate of 63.2% while the unemployment rate of those aged 25-34 years was 41.2% in the Q4 2020 unemployment rates by Statistics South Africa.
tsn: Ka Tlhakole, bašwa ba Aforikaborwa ba ba nang le dingwaga di le 15-24 ba begile palo e e kwa godimo ya botlhokatiro ya 63.2% fa palo ya botlhokatiro go bao ba ba nang le dingwaga di le 25-34 e le 41.2% mo dipalopalong tsa Aforikaborwa tsa botlhokatiro tsa Q4 2020.

en: Saul says the party should persevere in its quest to rid itself of corrupt leaders.
tsn: Saul a re mokgatlho o tshwanetse go kgotlhelela mo tirong ya bona ya go tlosa baeteledipele ba ba sa siamang.

en: He has called on Health Minister Dr Zweli Mkhize to present himself to the ANC integrity commission.
tsn: O biditse tonakgolo ya boitekanelo Dr Zweli Mkhize go itlhagisa mo khomišheneng e e ikanyegang ya ANC.

en: Pressure is mounting on Mkhize to resign after he admitted that his department’s awarding of a R150 million tender to communications company Digital Vibes was irregular.
tsn: Kgatelelo e a oketsega mo go Mkhize gore a role tiro morago ga go ipolela gore kabo ya thendara ya dimilione di le R150, e e abilweng ke lefapha la gagwe le e abela setheo sa tlhaeletsano se se bidiwang Digital Vibes, e ne e sa tlhomama.

en: Mkhize made the admission on Wednesday following the outcome of an internal investigation into the tender awarded to his former private assistant, Tahera Mathera, and former spokesperson, Naardhira Mitha.
tsn: Mkhize o dirile boipolelo ka Laboraro morago ga poelo ya dipatlisiso tsa  mo gare ga setheo, ka ga thendara e e abetsweng mothusi wa gagwe wa maloba, Tahera Mathera le mmueledi wa maloba , Naardhira Mitha.

en: The tender was for services related to the National Health Insurance programme and governments response to the COVID-19 pandemic.
tsn: Thendara e ne e le ya ditirelo tse di amanang le porogerama ya Inšorense ya Bosetšhaba ya Boitekanelo gape le tsibogelo ya puso go leroborobo la Covid-19

en: Saul says Mkhize should appear before the Commission as a matter of principle.
tsn: Saul a re Mkhize o tshwanetse go iponagatsha fa pele ga khomišhene jaaka molao o kaya.

en: Instead of us focusing fighting that pandemic, we get distracted by allegations of corruption from us who are supposed to be leading.
tsn: Go na la gore re tlhome mogopolo mo go lwantsheng leroborobo le, re tseakanngwa ke magatwe a tshekologo a a tswang mo go rona ba re tshwanetseng go etela pele.

en: There are serious allegations of corruption against an NEC member which is comrade Zweli Mkhize, who is currently deployed as minister of health.
tsn: Go na le ditatofatso tse di masisi kgatlhanong le wa leloko la NEC e leng khomoreite Zweli Mkhize, yo jaanong a tsentsweng mo tirong jaaka modiredi wa tsa boitekanelo.

en: If there are such allegations, in terms of the guidelines that were adopted by the NEC, expectation is that he should basically go to the Integrity Commission for the Integrity Commission to handle the matter and make recommendations to the NEC.
tsn: Fa go na le ditatofatso tse di tshwanang le tse, go ya ka dikaelo tse di amogetsweng ke mokgatlho wa NEC, go lebilwe gore o tshwanetse go ya kwa khomišheneng ya tsa molao gore e mekamekane le ntlha eno mme e dire dikatlenegiso go NEC.

en: Minister Mkhize must step down following tender investigation.
tsn: Tonakgolo Mkhize o tshwanetse go rola tiro go latela dipatlisiso tsa thendara.

en: The re-elected ANC chairperson in the Northern Cape, Zamani Saul, says the party needs to be ruthless in rooting out corruption in it’s ranks.
tsn: Modulasetulo yo o tlhopilweng gape kwa Northern Cape, Zamani Saul, o bolela gore mokgatlho o tshwanetse go nna le setlhogo go fedisa ditiro tse di seng ka fa molaong ka maemo a tsona.

en: He has called on the health minister, Zweli Mkhize, to present himself to the ANC Integrity Commission and explain following allegations of corruption.
tsn: O kopile tonakgolo ya boitekanelo, Zweli Mkhize go itlhagisa go khomišhene e e ikganyegang ya ANC le go tlhalosa dipatlisiso tse di latelang tsa tlolomolao.

en: Mkhize is under fire over irregular contracts valued at more than 150 million in relation to National Health Insurance (NHI) and COVID-19 awarded to his close associates.
tsn: Mkhize o mo mathateng ka ntlha ya dikonteraka tse di sa tlhomamang tsa boleng jwa dilimione tse di fetang 150 mabapi le Inšorense ya Bosetšhaba ya Boitekanelo (NHI) le COVID-19 tse di abetsweng batho ba a tsalanang le bona.

en: Instead of us focusing fighting that pandemic we get distracted by allegations of corruption from us who are supposed to be leading.
tsn: Mo boemong jwa gore re lwantshe leboroboro re tseakanngwa ke ditatofatso tsa boferefere go tswa mo go rona ba re tshwanetseng go etela pele.

en: There are serious allegations of corruption against an NEC member which is comrade Zweli Mkhize who is currently deployed as minister of health.
tsn: Go na le ditatofatso tse di masisi kgatlhanong le wa leloko la NEC e leng khomoreiti Zweli Mkhize yo ga jaana a rometsweng go dira jaaka tona ya boitekanelo.

en: If there are such allegations in terms of the guidelines that were adopted by the NEC, expectation is that he should basically go to the Integrity Commission for the Integrity Commission to handle the matter and make recommendations to the NEC, says Saul.
tsn: Fa go na le ditatofatso tsa go nna jalo go ya ka dikaelo tse di neng di amogetswe ke NEC, tsholofelo ke gore o tshwanetse go ya kwa khomišheneng ya tshiamiso, gore khomišhene e lebagane le morero o, le go dira dikatlenegiso go NEC, go bua Saul.

en: The Special Investigating Unit (SIU) is investigating the matter.
tsn: Yuniti e e kgethegileng ya dipatlisiso (SIU) e sekaseka morero.

en: President Ramaphosa awaits SIU report on Digital Vibes irregular tender allegations.
tsn: Moporesidente Ramaphosa o letile pego ya ditatofatso tsa thendara ya Digital Vibes e e sa tlhomamang.

en: Saul also weighed in on ANC Secretary-General Ace Magashule’s decision to take the party to court in a bid to have his suspension set aside.
tsn: Saul o ne a akanyetsa tshwetso ya mokwaledi-kakaretso e leng Ace Magashule ya go isa lekoko kwa kgotlhatshekelong ka maiteko a gore go kgapelwa kwa thoko ga gwage, go beelwe kwa thoko.

en: The Northern Cape ANC Chairperson has described Magashule’s move as embarrassing.
tsn: Modulasetulo wa leloko la ANC kwa Kapa Bokone o tlhalositse fa kgato ya ganMagashule e tlhabisa ditlhong.

en: Saul says Magashule thinks he is above the ANC constitution.
tsn: Saul a re fa Magashule  akanya gore o kwa godimo ga molaotheo wa leloko la ANC.

en: He says in the history of the movement they have never experienced such ill-disciplined Secretary General
tsn: A re mo hisetoring ya mokgatlho ga ba ise ba itemogele maitshwaro a a sa tlhomameng go tswa go mokwadilekakaretso

en: There is no renewal that will take place in an organisation which does not have capacity to instil discipline among its members.
tsn: Ga gona ntšhwafatso e e tlaa diragalang mo mokgatlhong o o senang bokgoni jwa go tlhotlheletsa maitshwaro a a siameng kgatlhanong le maloko a ona.

en: Step-aside is but one measure to ensure that we are going to put our organisation on a renewal trajectory.
tsn: ‘Step-aside’ ke nngwe ya dikgato tse di tserweng go netefatsa gore re tlile go tsenya setlamo sa rona mo tseleng ya ntšhwafatso.

en: The issue of the Secretary-General is, there is none of us, there is no self-respect in the member of the ANC who won’t be disappointed by Secretary-General who takes the ANC to court, and I get a sense that he is doing that because he’s got quite a distorted logic about his own role as the Secretary-General.
tsn: Ntlha ya mokwaledikakaretso ke gore, ga go ope wa rona, ga gona leloko la ANC le le itlotlang, le le  ka se swabiseweng ka mokwaledi-kakaretso yo o isang  mokgatlho wa ANC kwa kgotlhatshekelong, mme ke lemoga gore o dira jaana ka ntlha ya gore o na le dikakanyo tse di sa siamang ka ga seabe sa gagwe jaaka mokwaledikakaretso.

en: Saul was speaking on the side-line of the ANC Northern Cape elective conference held in Springbok
tsn: Saul o ne a bua a emetse kwa thoko ka kopano ya ditlhopho tsa ANC kwa Kapa Bokone e e neng e tshwaretswe kwa Springbok.

en: He says the party will recover from its current challenges
tsn: O bolela fa mokgatlho o tla fenya dikgwetlho tse o lebaganeng le tsona ga jaana.

en: Zamani criticises Magashule for taking the party to court: Cyril Ramaphosa also addressed the conference.
tsn: Zamani o nyatsa Magashule ka go isa mokgatlho kwa kgotlhatshekelong: Moporesidente Ramaphosa le ena o eme kopano ka lefoko.

en: He called on members to work harder to restore unity within the governing party, while also urging them to be selfless in serving their communities.
tsn: O kopile maloko gore ba dire ka natla go busetsa kutlwano mo mokgatlhong o o busang, gape a ba rotloetsa go nna direla baagi ba bona ka dipelo tse di tshweu..

en: In his address Ramaphosa said there’s no room within the ANC for ill-disciplined members.
tsn: Mo puong ya gagwe, Ramaphosa o rile ga gona sebaka sa maloko a a senang maitseo mo mokgatlhong wa ANC.

en: Ramaphosa reiterated that those who deviate from the ANC’s core values should be reprimanded.
tsn: Ramaphosa o gateletse gore ba ba fapogelang mekgwa e e botlhokwa ya ANC ba tshwanetse go kgalengwa.

en: We are determined to execute the mandate given to us by the Nasrec conference because delegates at that conference were clear that and said all NEC members of the ANC to branch members should work harder together to unite and rebuild this glorious movement of ours.
tsn: Re ikemiseditse go diragatsa taelo e e re neetsweng ke khonferense ya Nasrec ka gonne batsamaise ba khonferense eno ba buile gore maloko otlhe a NEC, a lekala la ANC a tshwanetse go dira mmogo le ka natla go kopanya le go aga bošwa mokgatlho o wa rona o o galalelang.

en: When we speak of unity, we are referring to principled unity and now you have coined it beautifully in the Northern Cape, organic unity.
tsn: Fa re bua ka ga kopano, re raya molaotheo, mme jaanong le e tlhamile sentle kwa Kapa Bokone, kopano e e tsepameng.

en: It is unity that must arise to the basic of the African National Congress, he said.
tsn: Ke kopano e e tshwanetseng go tlhagelela mo motheong wa African National Congress, o buile jalo.

en: The ANC in KwaZulu-Natal has called on the Department of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs to intervene after private security personnel entered the Nquthu Municipalitys Council Chambers and removed ANC councillors from the sitting.
tsn: Mokgatlho wa ANC wa KwaZulu-Natal o kopile Lefapha la Pusotshwaraganelo le Merero ya Setso go tsereganya morago ga gore badiredi ba tshireletso ya poraefete ba tsene kwa phaposing ya mmasepala wa kwa Nquthu mme ba tlose bakhanselara ba ANC kwa pitsong.

en: The incident, which was captured on video and circulated widely on social media, took place earlier this week.
tsn: Tiragalo e, e e neng e tshwerwe ka bidio gape e phasaladitswe mo bobegakgang jwa loago e diragetse go sa le gale mo bekeng e.

en: The video shows security guards manhandling an unidentified councillor
tsn: Kgatiso ya bidio e bontsha batlhankedi ba tshireletso ba kampana le mokhanselara yo leina la gagwe le sa rebolwang

en: Councillors can be heard shouting and asking what Zikode has done.
tsn: Go utlwagetse bakhanselara ba goeletsa le go botsa gore Zikode o dirileng.

en: The security officers, clad in heavy body armour, are seen grabbing two councillors and attempting to drag them from the chamber
tsn: Batlhankedi ba tshireletso, ba neng ba apere diaparo tse di bokete, ba bonwa ba tshwara bakhanselara ba babedi ka maiteko a go ba ntsha kwa phaposing.

en: The ANC in KwaZulu-Natal has accused the IFP of orchestrating the attack on their councillors.
tsn: ANC ya kwa kgaolong ya KwaZulu-Natal e latofatsa IFP ka go rulaganya tlhaselo ya bakhanselara ba bona.

en: The IFP could not engage on the rational points they were raising.
tsn: IFP e reteletswe ke go nna le seabe mo go sekasekeng dintlha tsa botlhokwa tse ba neng ba di tlhagisa.

en: They decided to bring in those thugs whom they hired to take out our councillors.
tsn: Ba tsere tshwetso ya go tlisa dinokwane tse ba di thapileng go ntsha bakhanselara ba rona.

en: These are not security employed by the municipality these are private thugs, says ANC KZN Spokesperson, Nhlakanipho Ntombela.
tsn: Ba, ga e se batlhakankedi ba tshireletso ba ba thapilweng ke mmasepala, ke dinokwane tsa poraefete. Go bua Mmueledi wa ANC wa kwa KZN Nhakanipho Ntombela.

en: But the IFP has dismissed the allegations.
tsn: Fela IFP e kgapetse ditatofatso tseo kwa thoko.

en: The party says it was the ANC councillors who were unruly.
tsn: Mokgatlho o buile gore bakhanselara ba ANC ke bona ba ba neng ba sa laolege.

en: The ANC councillors did not want to see the council meeting continuing.
tsn: Bakhanselara ba ANC ba ne ba sa batle go bona kopano ya khanselara e tswelela pele.

en: They really wanted to halt the council.
tsn: Ba ne tota ba batla go emisa khansele.

en: They did not want to see anything that had to be discussed of service delivery.
tsn: Ba ne ba sa batle go bona sepe se se neng se tshwanetse go buisanelwa ka thebolelo ya diterelo.

en: Whenever there are members who are disrupting the council you have to find ways and means to do that.
tsn: Fa go na le maloko a a lekang go kgoreletsa khansele, o tshwanetse go batla ditsela tsa go dira jalo.

en: Even the one who was recording you can see that it was well planned, well-orchestrated, says IFP Provincial Chairperson, Thami Ntuli.
tsn: Le ena yo o neng a gatisa, go a bontsha gore go ne go logilwe leano e bile go rulagantswe sentle. Go bua modulasetulo  wa porofense, Thami Ntuli.

en: The ANC believes that the election of the IFP’s current mayor Lindokuhle Shabalala  was unlawful.
tsn: ANC e dumela fa tlhopho ya mmeyara wa IFP wa ga jaana Lindokuhle Shabalala e ne e se ka fa molaong.

en: The party is citing the fact that the council meeting in which Shabalala was elected was held while the country was in level 5 lockdown as reason for its assertions.
tsn: Mokgatlho o umaka ntlha ya gore kopano ya khansele, e Shabalala a tlhopilweng kwa go yona, e diragetse fa naga e le ka fa tlase ga logato lwa 5 lwa kiletsomesepele ka ntlha ya go tlhoka boammaaruri.

en: The KwaZulu-Natal Department of Cooperative Governance and Traditional Affairs says it is aware of the dispute and will investigate further.
tsn: Lefapha la Pusotshwaraganelo le Merero ya Setso la KwaZulu- Natal le kaile fa le itse ka ga kgotlhang mme le tlaa sekaseka go ya pele.

en: Report by Bongani Gema
tsn: Pego ka Bongani Gema.

en: African National Congress (ANC) President Cyril Ramaphosa says the COVID-19 pandemic is the governing party’s first real test since its establishment.
tsn: Moporesidente wa ANC Cyril Ramaphosa a re leroborobo la COVID-19 ke teko ya ntlha ya nnete mo mokgatlhong fa e sa le o tlhongwa.

en: Ramaphosa says the ANC cannot point fingers and has to navigate the country through the storm.
tsn: Ramaphosa a re ANC e ka se supe ope ka menwana, mme e tshwanetse go bontsha naga tsela kgatlhanong le ditsuatsue.

en: He was speaking virtually at the ANC Northern Cape provincial conference, being held at Springbok.
tsn: O ne a bua kwa khonferense ya porofense  ya kwa Kapa Bokone e e ne e tshwaretswe kwa Springbok.

en: Apart from its effects on the health of people, COVID-19 has also devastated economies and lives.
tsn: Kwa ntle ga ditlamorago tse e nang le tsona mo boitekanelong jwa batho, COVID-19 gape e sentse gape ikonomi le matshelo a batho.

en: The COVID-19 pandemic saw South Africa’s economy depress even further, millions more became unemployed.
tsn: Leroborobo la COVID-19 le digile ikhonomi ya Aforika Borwa le go feta, dimilione tsa batho di feletswe ke ditiro.

en: With a third wave fast approaching, Ramaphosa says the ANC needs to play its part to stop the rise in numbers, this includes encouraging people to register for vaccinations.
tsn: Jaaka lekhubu la boraro le atamela ka lobelo, Ramaphosa a re ANC e tshwanetse go tshameka karolo ya yona go thibela koketsego ya dipalo, se se akaretsa go rotloetsa batho go ikwadisetsa go tsaya meento.

en: He says more than 100 countries have joined the call for pharmaceutical companies to waive intellectual property rights for COVID-19 vaccines.
tsn: A re di naga tse di fetang lekgolo di ditshwaragane mmogo le ditheo  tsa melemo go letlelela ditshwanelo tsa thoto ya boitlhamedi tsa meento ya COVID-19.

en: ANC President Cyril Ramaphosa addresses the Northern Cape elective conference.
tsn: Moporesidente wa ANC Cryil Ramaphosa o eme khonferese ya ditlhopho ya Kapa Bokone ka lefoko.

en: ANC Provincial Chairperson Zamani Saul has been a staunch critic of suspended Secretary-General Ace Magashule, calling him deeply compromised.
tsn: Modulasetulo wa porofense wa ANC Zamani Saul e ntse e le motshwayang diphoso yo mogolo wa mokwaledi-kakaretso yo o emisitsweng kwa tirong Ace Magashule, a re ke motho yo o nang le dikgwetlho di le dintsi.

en: Apart from COVID-19, the movement is also going through its own challenges such as ill-discipline.
tsn: Kwa ntle ga COVID-19, mokgatlho o lebagane gape le dikgwetlho tsa ona, jaaka maitshwaro a a sa tlhomamang.

en: Ever since Nasrec we have been trying to forge unity.
tsn: Fa e sa le Nasrec, re ntse re le leka go bopa kutlwano.

en: Call that comrade to order.
tsn: Kgalema mokhomoreite yoo.

en: That is unity, says Ramaphosa.
tsn: Ke yona kutlwano eo, go bua Ramaphosa.

en: Ramaphosa also called for the strengthening of policies and deployees to local government.
tsn: Ramaphosa o kopile gape gore go nne le maatlafatso ya dipholisi mo pusong ya selegae.

en: With local government elections in October, the ANC says it wants a resounding victory at the polls.
tsn: Jaaka fa ditlhopho tsa dipusoselegae tse di tlaa tshwarwa ka kgwedi ya Diphalane, ANC ya re e batla phenyo e e itumedisang kwa ditlhophong tseo.

en: NC ANC Chairperson Zamani Saul reacts to Ramaphosa’s address on provincial elective conference.
tsn: Modulasetulo wa ANC ya kwa NC Zamani Saul o tsibogela puo ya ga Ramaphosa ka ga khonferense ya ditlhopho ya porofense.

en: Political analyst Dr Luvuyo Dondolo says the African National Congress (ANC) needs a long term solution if it is to renew the movement.
tsn: Mosekaseki wa dipolotiki Ngaka Luvuyo Dondolo a re African National Congress (ANC) e tshwanetse go nna le tharabololo ya pakatelele fa e batla go ntšhwafatsa mokgatlho.

en: He says the ANC may regain a bit of trust following current interventions but going forward, they will have to put in more work.
tsn: A re ANC e ka tsosolosa tshepo gape, morago ga ditsereganyo tse di diragalang ga jaana fela go ya kwa pele, ba tlile go tlhoka go dira ka natla.

en: This after the ANC in the Eastern Cape announced tapping into the wisdom of those who led before by involving the former president Thabo Mbeki in a three-day Provincial Executive Committee meeting currently under way in East London.
tsn: Se ke morago ga gore ANC ya kwa Kapa Botlhaba e dire kitsiso ka ga go tsaya botlhale go tswa go ba ba neng ba busa pele ka go akaretsa moporesidente wa maloba Thabo Mbeki kwa kopanong ya malatsi a le mararo, ya komiti ya khuduthamaga ya porofense e e tshwerweng ga jaana kwa East London.

en: Dondolo says this is a short term strategy.
tsn: Dondolo o kaya fa se e le togamaano ya paka e khutshwane.

en: The involvement of former leaders such as Thabo Mbeki, leaders who are perceived to have the moral compass as a way of this renewal of the ANC is short term.
tsn: Go nna le seabe ga baeteledipele ba maloba ba ba tshwanang le Thabo Mbeki, baeteledipele ba ba nang le maitsholo a a siameng  jaaka tsela ya go ntšhwafatsa ANC, ke selo sa nakwana.
